metadata.title: CVE-2020-25687 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: A flaw was found in dnsmasq before version 2.83. A heap-based buffer overflow was discovered in dnsmasq when DNSSEC is enabled and before it validates the received DNS entries. This flaw allows a remote attacker, who can create valid DNS replies, to cause an overflow in a heap-allocated memory. This flaw is caused by the lack of length checks in rfc1035.c:extract_name(), which could be abused to make the code execute memcpy() with a negative size in sort_rrset() and cause a crash in dnsmasq, resulting in a denial of service. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability.

criterions.comment: dnsmasq package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.82-1ubuntu2').
